articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Biden signs bill passed by Congress to fund agencies until Nov. 17, averting government shutdown.
articles.title: President Biden signs bill passed by Congress to fund agencies until Nov. 17, averting government shutdown

articles.author: LISA MASCARO, KEVIN FREKING and STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The threat of a federal government shutdown suddenly lifted late Saturday as President Joe Biden signed a temporary funding bill to keep agencies open with little time to spare after Congress rushed to approve the bipartisan deal.
articles.title: Government shutdown averted with little time to spare as Biden signs funding before midnight

articles.author: JOHN O'CONNOR and COLLEEN SLEVIN
articles.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — Five people were killed and five were seriously injured after a truck overturned in central Illinois, causing a toxic substance to leak from its cargo and forcing the evacuation of hundreds of area residents, authorities said Saturday.
articles.title: A truck crash in Illinois kills 5, seriously injures 5 and forces an evacuation due to ammonia leak

articles.author: JEFF McMILLAN
articles.description: Dianne Feinstein once stood at the center of a pivotal moment in LGBTQ+ history. Decades later, in death, she's being lauded by LGBTQ+ leaders as a longtime ally who, if she didn't always initially do the right thing, was able to learn and evolve.
articles.title: Dianne Feinstein was at the center of a key LGBTQ+ moment. She's being lauded as an evolving ally

articles.author: RIO YAMAT and KEN RITTER
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — The first arrest in the 1996 slaying of Tupac Shakur had its roots in the investigation of the killing of Biggie Smalls.
articles.title: Arrest in Tupac Shakur killing stemmed from Biggie Smalls death investigation

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Supreme Court is returning to a new term to take up some familiar topics — guns and abortion — and concerns about ethics swirling around the justices.
articles.title: The Supreme Court will take up abortion and gun cases in its new term while ethics concerns swirl

articles.author: BRITTANY PETERSON and MICHAEL PHILLIS
articles.description: Hours before devastating fires scorched the historic town of Lahaina on Maui, Kyle Ellison labored to save his rental house in Kula, a rural mountain town 24 miles away, from a different blaze.
articles.title: When Kula needed water to stop wildfire, it got a trickle. Many other US cities are also vulnerable

articles.author: ADAM BEAM
articles.description: SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) — California won't be giving unemployment checks to workers on strike, with Democratic Gov. Gavin Newsom vetoing a bill Saturday that had been inspired by high-profile work stoppages in Hollywood and the hotel industry.
articles.title: California governor rejects bill to give unemployment checks to striking workers

articles.author: SUMMER BALLENTINE
articles.description: The police chief who led a highly criticized raid of a small Kansas newspaper has been suspended, the mayor confirmed to The Associated Press on Saturday.
articles.title: The police chief who led a raid of a small Kansas newspaper has been suspended

articles.author: CLAIRE RUSH
articles.description: A federal agency has sued the restaurant chain Chipotle, accusing it of religious harassment and retaliation after a manager at a Kansas location forcibly removed an employee's hijab, a headscarf worn by some Muslim women.
articles.title: Federal agency sues Chipotle after a Kansas manager allegedly ripped off an employee's hijab
